content.description:
The following balanced equation represents the decomposition of hydrogen peroxide, <math alttext="H 2 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.
<math alttext="2 H 2 O 2, aqueous, reacts to produce 2 H 2 O, liquid, plus O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

A student carries out an experiment in which a sample of <math alttext="H 2 O 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> decomposes in the presence of <math alttext="M n O 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>MnO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>. The student measures the volume of <math alttext="O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> produced by the reaction at regular intervals while the temperature is held constant. The student’s data are given in the following table.
 Time (s)Volume of <math alttext="O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> Collected <math alttext="(in milliliters)" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>mL</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0</mn></math> <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0</mn></math> <math alttext="60" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>60</mn></math> <math alttext="42" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>42</mn></math><math alttext="120" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>120</mn></math> <math alttext="64" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>64</mn></math><math alttext="180" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>180</mn></math> <math alttext="76" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>76</mn></math><math alttext="240" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>82</mn></math><math alttext="300" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>300</mn></math> <math alttext="86" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>360</mn></math> <math alttext="88" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>88</mn></math><math alttext="420" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>420</mn></math> <math alttext="89" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>89</mn></math>
content.question: The student observes that under the same conditions, the reaction occurs at a much slower rate when <math alttext="M n O 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MnO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is not used. Which of the following statements best explains this observation?

choices.label: <math alttext="M n O 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MnO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> changes the reaction from endothermic to exothermic.

<math alttext="M n O 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MnO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> shifts the equilibrium position of the reaction from reactant favored to product favored.

<math alttext="M n O 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MnO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> releases heat in order to start the reaction.

<math alttext="M n O 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MnO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> provides a reaction pathway with a lower activation energy.

content.answer: <math alttext="M n O 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MnO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> provides a reaction pathway with a lower activation energy.

skill.text: 6.F: Explain the connection between experimental results and chemical concepts, processes, or theories.
